questions.question_text:
An after trigger on the Account object performs a DML update operation on all of the child Opportunities of an Account. There are no active triggers on the
Opportunity object, yet a `maximum trigger depth exceeded` error occurs in certain situations.
Which two reasons possibly explain the Account trigger firing recursively? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Changes are being made to the Account during an unrelated parallel save operation.
choices.D: Changes are being made to the Account during Criteria Based Sharing evaluation.
choices.A: Changes to Opportunities are causing cross-object workflow field updates to be made on the Account.
choices.B: Changes to Opportunities are causing roll-up summary fields to update on the Account.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about developing in a multi-tenant environment?

choices.C: Governor limits prevent Apex from impacting the performance of multiple tenants on the same instance.
choices.A: Apex Sharing controls access to records from multiple tenants on the same instance.
choices.B: Org-level data security controls which users can see data from multiple tenants on the same instance.
choices.D: Global Apex classes can be referenced from multiple tenants on the same instance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text:
A developer needs an Apex method that can process Account or Contact records.
Which method signature should the developer use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It says Account OR Contact, not any object
Pretty certain it should be A and D if the update is happening on an UN-related record

Selected Answer: BC
Those answer are correct

Selected Answer: AD
A and D

Selected Answer: AD
Agree with the other comments here.

Selected Answer: AD
updating records (other than the one in context) has to be done in an After event. Best practice 101.

comments.content: Just by using pure "logic", you want to be sure that the record is being saved in the database before creating another record, even if is UN-related.

discussion.content: There is no need to access the record id of the record being inserted to create the un-related one so "before" works fine. So b and C is fine for me.
